icontrol

Class IcontrolView

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jdesktop.application.AbstractBean
      • org.jdesktop.application.View
        • org.jdesktop.application.FrameView
          • icontrol.IcontrolView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    GUI_Interface

    public final class IcontrolView
extends org.jdesktop.application.FrameView
implements GUI_Interface
    The View-Class that shows and handles the GUI (the application's main frame).

    Version:
    0.4
    Author:
    KPP (Kurt Pernstich: pernstich@alumni.ethz.ch)

      The user pressed the 'Python' button, so start a new Python Interpreter

      Asks the user to specify a file location and saves the current script as a script file (which is a simple text file containing all command lines).

      The User selected an Instrument Command, has hopefully supplied reasonable values in the Table and wants to add this command to the script list.

      GENERAL / MAKE:
      Adds a line to the script list when the left-arrow button in the Make New instrument section is pressed.

      This method is called when the user selects the left arrow to include a sub-script in the script.

      Add the command line entered by the user in the GUI to the script list.

      Allows the user to select a script file which can then be included as a sub-script in a script.

      Called when the User selects to send the Command in the Table directly and instantly to the Instrument.

      • m_ScriptInstruments

        private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> m_ScriptInstruments
        Contains InstrumentName - InstrumentClassName pairs of all Instruments used in the Script (for instance PA / Agilent 4155, Tsample / Lakeshore 340, srs / SRS DS 345).
        It is populated in ScriptAddLine, and entries are deleted from within jScriptListKeyReleased. It is used in jInstrumentNameSelected to identify the Instrument-Class respectively the generic GPIB Instrument.

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused(boolean WaitUntilNotPaused)
        This method returns true if Scripting has been paused (either by the user pressing 'Pause' button or by enabling Options/AutoPause) and false if the Script is being processed. The method returns immediately if Scripting has been stopped (because the user pressed the 'Stop' button).

        When WaitUntilNotPaused is set to true, the method waits until the Script is being processed (Scripting has been resumed if it was paused), and in this case, always returns false.

        Specified by:
        isPaused in interface GUI_Interface
        Parameters:
        WaitUntilNotPaused - When false the method returns immediately the present state of scripting, and waits until the Script is being executed when set to true.
        Returns:
        true when scripting is paused, and false if the script is being processed.

      • isAutoPaused

        public boolean isAutoPaused()
        Getter method for the state of the menu item to select Auto-Pausing of the Script. When true
        Specified by:
        isAutoPaused in interface GUI_Interface
        Returns:
        Returns true if the user selected Auto-Pausing of the script, which means that the Dispatcher class re-enables pausing of the script after each script line.

      • getFileName

        public java.lang.String getFileName(java.lang.String FileExtension)
        Returns the FileName including the project path as specified in the GUI. The FileExtension is also appended, and if no '.' was specified, it is added automatically. If the resultant file name already exists in the project directory, a counter is added, so that no files are overwritten.
        Specified by:
        getFileName in interface GUI_Interface
        Parameters:
        FileExtension - This String is appended to the FileName; if it does not include a '.', a '.' is added. If FileExtension is an empty String, only Path+FileName is returned. If the file exists, a counter is added before the extension.
        Returns:
        FileName including path and FileExtension

      • getProjectPath

        public java.lang.String getProjectPath()
        Returns the Project Path including a file separator at the end
        Specified by:
        getProjectPath in interface GUI_Interface
        Returns:
        ProjectPath including file separator

      • jCommandListGetToolTipText

        private java.lang.String jCommandListGetToolTipText(java.awt.event.MouseEvent evt)
        Returns the ToolTip Text for the item in the jCommandList. The default code generated for the jList from NetBeans has been modified (right click on the jList and choose Custom Code) to call this method.

        The ToolTipText is taken from the ScriptMethod which is stored in the elements of the List.

        Parameters:
        evt - holds the position of the mouse.
        Returns:
        A String that holds the ToolTip Text (DescripttionForUser in the AutoGUIAnnotation.

      • ScriptAddMake

        @Action
public void ScriptAddMake()
        GENERAL / MAKE:
        Adds a line to the script list when the left-arrow button in the Make New instrument section is pressed. See Dispatcher for details on the command MAKE.

        General command form: MAKE InstrumentName; Instrument_Model; GPIB_Address or MAKE InstrumentName; Instrument_Model; RS232 port parameters or MAKE InstrumentName; Instrument_Model; URL (IP address of host name for LAN (TCP/IP) communication)

        See Also:
        Dispatcher

      • ScriptAddUserLine

        @Action
public void ScriptAddUserLine()
        Add the command line entered by the user in the GUI to the script list.

      • ScriptAddLine

        private void ScriptAddLine(java.lang.String CommandLine)
        Adds the given String to the script list.
        The string is added to the end of the script if no command line is selected, or adds it below the current selection. Also sets the new selection to the line just added.

        It also sets the Script-Modified flag to true.

        Remark: Because tab-characters (\t) did not show up on Windows tab-characters are replaced with space.
        Remark: Because empty lines are not shown in a JTable, a space is added to empty lines.

        Parameters:
        CommandLine - This string is added to the command list

      • Start

        @Action
public void Start()
        This action starts the processing of the script in a new Dispatcher thread.

        This method also checks if the Project Directory specified in the GUI exists, and ask the user to create the directory in case it doesn't.

        A message is shown to the user if the files that start with the File Name specified in the GUI already exist. The user can then select to overwrite the files or cancel Start processing the script.

        When logging GPIB traffic is enabled, a buffered file-writer is opened in 'User-home/iC log' with the current date and time to save all GPIB I/O.

        See Also:
        Dispatcher

      • DoneScripting

        public void DoneScripting(boolean ErrorOccurred)
        This method is called by the Dispatcher after the script has been processed. Used to clean up the GUI (re-enable start/stop) buttons, and show the user a message.
        Specified by:
        DoneScripting in interface GUI_Interface
        Parameters:
        ErrorOccurred - is true when an error occurred during processing the script, and is used to suppress the message to the user

      • DisplayStatusMessage

        public void DisplayStatusMessage(java.lang.String StatusMessage)
        Adds the given String to the Status text Area with a time stamp. See DisplayStatusMessage(String, boolean) for details. Remark: Maybe this method will be made non-static again. (replace m_GUI first)
        Specified by:
        DisplayStatusMessage in interface GUI_Interface
        Parameters:
        StatusMessage - - the String to display

      • DisplayStatusMessage

        public void DisplayStatusMessage(java.lang.String StatusMessage,
                                 boolean AddTimeStamp)
        Adds the given String to the Status Text Area in the GUI. It allows to specify if a time stamp should preceed the given String. This method is called by the overloaded method of DisplayStatusMessage that takes only one parameter and provides a default value for AddTimeStamp. If StatusMessage contains the String "Warning" or "Error" (case insensitive) then the font color is changed to highlight this error. All messages displayed are also logged.
        Specified by:
        DisplayStatusMessage in interface GUI_Interface
        Parameters:
        StatusMessage - - the String to display
        AddTimeStamp - it true a time stamp is added in front of the the String to display.

      • DisplayStatusLine

        public java.lang.String DisplayStatusLine(java.lang.String StatusText,
                                          boolean FadeOut)
        Displays a text in the Status bar. If selected, the text fades out after a brief moment as defined in the constructor.
        Specified by:
        DisplayStatusLine in interface GUI_Interface
        Parameters:
        StatusText - The text to display
        FadeOut - If true the timer is started after which the text fades out.
        Returns:
        The text previously shown in the Status bar

      • FileLoad

        @Action
public void FileLoad()
        Asks the user to specify a script file and loads it. If the current script is not empty, the user is asked to either discard the current script and load the new script, or append the new script below the current selection. Updates the Script-Modified flag

      • FileAppend

        @Action
public void FileAppend()
        Asks the user to specify a script file and appends it to the current script. This method is called when the user selects the menu entry File/Append.

      • LoadScript

        private void LoadScript(java.lang.String Title,
                        java.lang.String FileName)
                 throws java.io.FileNotFoundException
        This is a helper function for FileLoad and FileAppend. It opens a dialog to let the user choose a script file which is then appended to the script at the current position. If the script was empty, this is equivalent to loading a new script.

        If the optional argument FileName is specified, no dialog is presented to the user and it is interpreted as the file name of the script to load. This is mainly used for testing/debugging in myInit.

        If the file was successfully read, it stores it's name in iC_User.properties so that upon a new start of iC, the same file is loaded. For now, this feature is enabled only when iC.Debug=1. Upon saving a script, iC.LastLoaded is also updated.

        Parameters:
        Title - This String will be displayed in the title bar of the dialog
        FileName - If FileName is specified it is interpreted as the file name of the script to load. An empty string causes a dialog to be presented to the user asking to select a script file.
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when the file could not be found

      • SaveScript

        @Action
public void SaveScript()
        Asks the user to specify a file location and saves the current script as a script file (which is a simple text file containing all command lines). Updates the Script-Modified flag. Also saves the chosen FileName in iC_User.properties so that this script is loaded next time iC is started (currently this is done only when iC.Debug=1)

      • FileNew

        @Action
public void FileNew()
        Deletes the current script and updates the Script-Modified flag. Called when the User selects "New" from the "File" Menu. A dialog is presented if the script is modified since it was last saved.

      • ChooseProjectDir

        @Action
public void ChooseProjectDir()
        Allows the user to select a Project Directory. There is a bug that disables the 'Create new directory' button on certain directories on WinXP and apparently also on MacOS: http://bugs.sun.com/bugdatabase/view_bug.do?bug_id=4847375

      • SelectScriptToInclude

        @Action
public void SelectScriptToInclude()
        Allows the user to select a script file which can then be included as a sub-script in a script.

        When the selected script is in the default include directory specified in m_DefaultIncludePath, then only the filename without the path is shown. Successive code will check if the filename includes the System's file-separator, and if not, the default directory will be appended automatically. This way the most common sub-scripts don't get cluttered up with long path names.

      • ScriptAddInstrumentCommand

        @Action
public void ScriptAddInstrumentCommand()
        The User selected an Instrument Command, has hopefully supplied reasonable values in the Table and wants to add this command to the script list. This method adds the corresponding string to the script list.

      • Pause

        @Action
public void Pause()
        This method is called when the user presses the Pause/Continue button. It toggles the Pause Status Flag and changes the text of the button between "Pause" and "Continue".
        Specified by:
        Pause in interface GUI_Interface

      • Stop

        @Action
public void Stop()
        Called when the user presses the Stop button. It sets the m_Stop flag, which is used by the instruments to terminate any threads (for instance in MonitorTemp). Also changes the state of some buttons in the GUI.
        Specified by:
        Stop in interface GUI_Interface
        See Also:
        iC_Instrument.MonitorChart(float, String, String, String, String, String, String, String)

      • ScriptAddSubScript

        @Action
public void ScriptAddSubScript()
        This method is called when the user selects the left arrow to include a sub-script in the script. It adds a new command line to the script.

      • SendNow

        @Action
public void SendNow()
        Called when the User selects to send the Command in the Table directly and instantly to the Instrument.

      • myInit

        protected void myInit()
        my Initializations: myInit is called after the standard initializations of the View class from IcontrolView<\code>.

        All variables that this call uses are initialized here. Also some elements of the GUI are initialized. Add your own inits here.

        To enable the Debug mode, change the entry 'iC.Debug' in iC.properties - it might be necessary to Clean&Build after changing property files.
